ai.summary: Cashel Lough is a short, easy lakeside walk in the UK. At about 0.6 km, the route is a gentle stroll along the lough with minimal elevation change, making it suitable for families and casual walkers seeking a tranquil outdoor experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The hike follows a flat, surfaced path along the water’s edge. Expect a well-maintained, level route with occasional grass or compact earth sections; conditions can be muddy after rain. Stay on the designated path and watch for puddles near the shoreline.
ai.safety_notes: Carry weather-appropriate clothing; wear sturdy footwear; stay on marked paths and avoid getting close to the water’s edge where banks may be unstable. Supervise children, bring a charged phone for emergencies, and be mindful of reduced daylight in winter.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for milder weather and better light; visits in winter are possible with appropriate clothing.

seo.title: Cashel Lough: Easy 0.6 km Lakeside Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Cashel Lough, a short and easy 0.6 km lakeside hike in the UK. Family-friendly, flat terrain, safety tips, gear list, and the best seasons for this tranquil stroll.
